help.step_1: Drag the convex lens from the shelf to the work area
help.step_2: Drag the illuminated object from the shelf to the work area
help.step_3: Drag the Screen from the shelf to the work area and switch on the bulb inside the object box. (click the mouse on the switch)
help.step_4: Drag the Scale from the shelf to the work area
help.step_5: Adjust the distance between the convex lens and illuminated object to be 26 cm.
help.step_6:
*Adjust the distance between the screen and convex lens to get a well defined image.
*Move the scale to measure the distance between the convex lens and screen.
*Click on the Table and enter the readings.
help.step_7:
* Click next. Now convex mirror is enabled.
*Bring the convex mirror from the shelf to the work area and place it between the convex lens and screen.
*Adjust the convex mirror alone to get a well defined image by the side of the object itself
*Measure the distance between screen and the convex mirror which is the radius of curvature of the convex mirror
*Enter it in the table and check.
help.step_8: Click previous button and repeat the experiment keeping the distance between convex lens and illuminated object to be 28 cm and 30 cm.
help.step_9:
*Find the mean value of the radius of curvature R.
*The focallength of the convex mirror f=R/2.
help.step_10: You have successfully calculated the Radius of curvature and focal length of the convex mirror.
